sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the smallest number of people that need to be invited to a party to guarantee that either there are at least 3 people who all know each other, or at least 3 people who are all strangers to each other? In other words, what is the Ramsey number R(3,3)?
message_2: The smallest number of people that need to be invited to a party to guarantee that either there are at least 3 people who all know each other, or at least 3 people who are all strangers to each other is 6. This is the Ramsey number R(3,3).
